properties.address: Settle Community & Business Hub, North Yorkshire BD24 9RH
properties.description: We hold a weekly knit and natter group in our office between 10am and 12 noon every Wednesday all year round. This started as a Warm Space in Autumn of 2022 but we decided to keep it going weekly as people liked coming. Free tea and coffee. Material, wool, fabric, knitting needles, sewing machine are available or bring your own craft projects. We sometimes do workshops like lampshade making or felting but it is all very informal. Natterers are always welcome so no obligation to knit or sew! Our Community Fridge is open at the same time in the office next door mostly offering fruit, veg and bread so people are welcome to bring what they can and take what they need.
properties.title: Knit and Natter

properties.address: Settle Victoria Hall, North Yorkshire BD24 9DZ
properties.description: Open to all of all and any age , with children's play area and a cafe.
properties.title: Miss Victoria'a Winter Refreshment Gardens

properties.address: Settle Victoria Hall, North Yorkshire BD24 9DZ
properties.description: Miss Victoria's Winter Gardens are a warm, welcoming space in the cosy surroundings of the world's oldest music hall. We welcome families, dogs, and anyone looking for a warm welcome and a friendly chat, or just a place to sit. Hot drinks, cakes, soup, jacket potatoes and specials are available, with all proceeds supporting the work of Settle Victoria Hall. Open 9am-3pm, Monday-Friday.
properties.title: Miss Victoria's Winter Gardens

properties.address: Settle Community Library, North Yorkshire BD24 9RB
properties.description: The space is open to all during library opening hours (M 2-5, Tu 10-1 & 2-5, Th 10-1 & 2-5, Fri 2-5, Sat 10-12.30, has library activities including Knit & Natter, Lego Club and Stay & Play, and is available for hire at other times.
properties.title: Settle Community Library

properties.address: Settle Quaker Meeting House, North Yorkshire BD24 9DX
properties.description: We started our Public Living Room at Settle Quakers in Autumn 2022 and these run twice a week all year round. More info on Camerados who started the Public Living Rooms can be found here https://camerados.org/public-living-room/ Everyone is welcome. Hot and cold drinks, soup and hot meals always available. We have a selection of games, a local paper and always have a jigsaw on the go. In warmer weather we often take people down to our allotment to help out there or go on short walks. We sometimes do art and craft activities like making soap or beeswax wraps. Hub staff are always available if someone needs a bit of extra help eg with bills, making appointments, benefits or other issues. We have good links with other local organisations, especially Age UK and The Place, so can take people to them for help and advice if need be.
properties.title: Settle Public Living Room
